title: ML Fundamentals - Supervised Learning, Model Evaluation, and Overfitting

notes.structure: Well-organized with clear sections, includes 5-minute break
notes.challenges: Must handle mid-lecture break (16:55-21:55), some concepts could be split or merged
notes.qa_sections: Brief Q&A at end (37:25-38:45), integrated into summary concept

concept_rationale.rationale: Introduction and core definition, sets up paradigm shift from traditional programming
Core distinction between problem types with house price example
Training process, train-test split, linear regression example
Evaluation metrics for classification, accuracy pitfalls, disease example
Shorter concept leading into break - introduces overfitting definition and analogy
Post-break continuation: prevention strategies, validation sets, cross-validation
Fundamental tradeoff concept, target/arrow analogy, practical monitoring
Hands-on walkthrough tying concepts together, code examples

break_info.note: Break should be excluded from concept extraction - no content during this period
